New Records: Fazalhaq Farooqi took five wickets for just nine runs, a remarkable bowling figure.
Rahmanullah Gurbaz and Ibrahim Zadran's opening partnership of 154 was the second highest in men’s T20 World Cup history.
Key Match Events: Rahmanullah Gurbaz scored 76 off 45 balls, including four fours and four sixes.
Ibrahim Zadran scored 70 off 46 deliveries, including nine fours and a six.
Fazalhaq Farooqi took five wickets for just nine runs, dismantling Uganda's batting lineup.
Uganda were bowled out for 58 in 16 overs.
Masaba took Uganda's first ever World Cup wicket by bowling Zadran.
Cosmas Kyewuta took two wickets for Uganda.
Afghanistan won the match by 125 runs.
Post-Match Reflections: Afghanistan captain Rashid Khan praised the team's overall effort and mindset.
Uganda skipper Masaba expressed pride in hearing their national anthem and seeing their flag at the World Cup, despite the heavy defeat.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was held at Guyana National Stadium in Providence, Guyana.
This was Uganda's debut in the T20 World Cup.
